sub_title: Consultant Leisure, Tourism & Heritage at Bureau BUITEN
summary:
Tourism is my passion. The industry offers various opportunities; exciting destinations, niche products, a lifestyle brand, and selling one of the most perishable commodities on Earth. These are all elements, which require management and organisational skills of well-trained and enthusiastic professionals. 

My name is Romy Beemsterboer, 30-years old. Questions that trigger me are: ‘What motivates tourists to visit destinations?’ ‘How does this travel affect local cultures and economies?’ ‘And how do issues on sustainability, authenticity, identity and commercialization fit into the picture?’ I consider tourism as an adventure, education, and experience all rolled into one. The dynamic industry is a continuous learning experience. It is both ‘science and art’ – ‘art’ in terms of places we sell and the richness of cultures we enjoy, and ‘science’ in terms of managing the business side of it. 

MY SPECIALITIES
- Sustainable (tourism) development
- Experiential and international approach
- Historical and philosophical perspective, using socio-cultural theories in tourism
- Advanced research techniques and methods in social sciences (quantitative and qualitative)
- Change, inter-human processes and communication
- Academic consultancy

MY CORE VALUES 
Communicative - Dedicated - Entrepreneurial - Goal oriented - Inquisitive - Professional - Team Player

MY PERSONAL INTERESTS 
Indoor biking (spinning) - Mountainbiking - Cycling Racing - Hiking - Yoga - Travelling

I am an enthusiastic, passionated and ambitious individual. It is of great significance to give all you have got if you love what you do. And I love travelling, when my passion becomes my profession; it will not feel like work. Am I the person you are looking for? Let’s meet!

education.field_of_study: Hoger Toeristisch en Recreatief Onderwijs/ Tourism and Recreation Management

school.name: Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: ATLAS annual conference 2016
projects.description:
In 2016 the Association for Tourism and Leisure Education (ATLAS) celebrated its 25th anniversary. ATLAS was established to develop transnational educational initiatives in leisure and tourism. A forum is provided to promote staff and student exchange, transnational research and to facilitate curriculum and professional development. The association currently has members in about 60 countries. 

As part of my personal and professional development, I got a great opportunity to attend the annual conference 'Tourism, Lifestyles & Locations'. The conference was hosted by Canterbury Christ Church University whereby the organising committee brought together all old, current and new ATLAS members as well as welcome non-members to the ATLAS family. Their aim was to push the boundaries of understanding tourism and its relationship to modern lifestyles and to destinations in a contemporary environment. 

It was a pleasure to join this conference and meet so many leisure and tourism associates. Hope to see you all in the near future!

contributors.headline: Consultant Leisure, Tourism & Heritage at Bureau BUITEN

projects.title: IMPACT 2016
projects.description: On 24 February 2016, we organized the annual IMPACT event for BSc Tourism and MSc Leisure, Tourism and Environment students. This was an educational and fun day at Wageningen University & Research where the students were informed and more importantly inspired about the possibilities for their future during and after their studies.

contributors.headline: Consultant Leisure, Tourism & Heritage at Bureau BUITEN
Medior adviseur ruimtelijke economie & vrijetijdseconomie - Ginder

courses.name: Educational programme in applied touristic topography (Topotoko, Haarlem)

profile_positions.description:
Bureau BUITEN answers your questions about spatial economics, sustainability & energy and leisure, tourism & heritage. With a fresh perspective, we work on solutions that make your municipality or region stronger, more sustainable and more beautiful.

We are knowledgeable - whether it concerns a transformation of a business park, a plan for recreational area development or applying for a European subsidy for an innovative project within the circular economy.

We offer several services. We conduct research and provide advice that you can use to get started. We are skilled project and process managers and we know the way to European subsidies. Are you looking for temporary support? This can be done through secondment.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Leisure, Tourism & Heritage

profile_positions.description: At Riksja Travel we believe in creating personal and meaningful holidays, taking travellers to the heart of our destinations. Our style of travel is unique - using destination expertise, the team has carefully created a choice of bite-size trips typically 2-4 days long (unless people fancy staying longer). These include local excursions, charming authentic accommodation and all connecting transport. People can build their own holiday by piecing these trips together to create a perfect itinerary, or they let me know what they like and I will put together a dream trip to Indonesia.
profile_positions.title: Travel Specialist Indonesia, Malaysia, Japan and Morocco

profile_positions.description:
EF Education First is 46,500 staff, faculty and teachers, working in 500 offices and schools across 53 countries. While they continue to grow, they strive to stay small so as to ensure agility, smart thinking and a fun place to work. For the past 50 years, EF has grown to include a range of programs that give students of all ages the freedom and confidence to explore the world through language, travel and education. 

My responsibilities included, but were not limited to: 
- Full ownership of the administrative tasks of our booking and invoicing process in the Netherlands
- Managing all customer bookings in our system
- Overseeing prospective students in completing the admissions process in a timely, efficient and seamless manner
- Ensuring that all customer invoices are processed
- Providing guidance regarding visa procedures and booking flights
- Complaint handling and point of contact for our schools worldwide, parents and students.
- Maintaining an excellent customer relationship and providing quality service before and after the customers course with EF
profile_positions.title: Customer Support Manager

profile_positions.description:
EF Education First was founded in 1965 and has become world leader in international 
education; built on experiential learning, cultural immersion and authentic connections. My responsibilities were:
- Giving presentations to potential students about the language and study programs
- Presence at fairs on various locations in The Netherlands
- Administrative tasks
- Being a contact person and sharing my own experience
profile_positions.title: Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
EF Education First was founded in 1965 and has become world leader in international 
education; built on experiential learning, cultural immersion and authentic connections. I was responsible for communicative and administrative tasks.
profile_positions.title: Customer Support Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Nottingham City Council commissioned Scott McCabe (Professor of Marketing & Tourism), Jillian Rickly (Assistant Professor in Tourism Management & Marketing) and myself to conduct a research for a tourism economic impact evaluation. This study was focused on the key anchor events of its newly established October Festival programme (i.e. Goose Fair and Robin Hood Pageant). The City Council has initiated this targeted programme to stimulate the visitor economy by developing a vibrant and attractive city centre as part of the city's drive to move from 'Good to Great' by 2020. 

My duties were as follows:
- To complete literature research on the economic impact of events
- To undertake primary research and to participate in training and supervising undergraduate students on the impact evaluation survey, data entry and analysis
- To enter data, analyse findings and write a report for Nottingham City Council
- To make a presentation to the City Council
- To lead tutorials on the module 'Tourism Future: The Challenge of Sustainability' associated with the project
- Any other duties arising
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description: Licere is the study association of the MSc programme Leisure, Tourism and Environment at Wageningen University & Research. The board of six international students organized both study related activities (study groups, field trips) and social activities/ excursions (dinners, weekend trips).
profile_positions.title: Commissioner of Education, Licere Board

profile_positions.description:
Peppers Awaroa Lodge is an eco-lodge (Earth Check Benchmarked Silver Status) that is remotely located in the Abel Tasman National Park on the South Island of New Zealand. I experienced working in a multi-cultural environment and built cultural awareness. Additionally I improved my communication skills and developed new attitudes/ perspectives that are uniquely my own. My responsibilities were: 
- Meeting, greeting and serving guests
- Taking and delivering food & beverage orders
- Helping out in other departments
profile_positions.title: Food and Beverage Attendant/ Guest Service Agent

profile_positions.description:
Bistro 't Schippersrijk is a small restaurant, located in the recreational area 'het Uitgeestermeer'​. My responsibilities were: 
- Making the guests feel welcomed/ comfortable
- Taking/ delivering food and beverage orders in a timely manner
profile_positions.title: Waitress

company.name: Tenzing Travel (voorheen Kuoni) owned by New Dutch Travel Company BV

profile_positions.description:
Tenzing Travel is a service provider to the global travel industry, specialized in organizing journeys to Africa, Asia, Pacific, Caribbean, North America and Latin America. My responsibilities were:
- Conducting research regarding a competitive analysis
- Assisting in the delivery of data
- Assisting in applying for/ obtaining sales and marketing related travel
- Cooperating with external relations
- Implementing changes in systems used by Tenzing (for example Da Vinci)
- Calculating retail prices according to the enhanced guidelines
- Establishing and modifying car rental conditions
- Attending workshops
profile_positions.title: Internship

profile_positions.description: Van der Valk is the largest hospitality chain in The Netherlands, with 59 branches in The Netherlands and 30 hotels in other countries. As a waitress, I was responsible for making the guests feel comfortable/ welcomed and delivering food in a timely manner.
profile_positions.title: Waitress

volunteer_experiences.description:
During the Ikano Bank Robin Hood Marathon and Half Marathon on Sunday 25 September 2016 I was part of the dedicated volunteering team and one of the 'Race Makers'. 

Thousands of runners took part in this iconic event, taking in the sights of Nottingham's historic and beautiful City, as well as raising thousands of pounds for local, national and international charities. I supported them on their journey to the finish line.

volunteer_experiences.role: Robin Hood Beer & Cider Festival Volunteer
volunteer_experiences.description:
Home to one of the most infamous heroes in the United Kingdom, Nottingham celebrated this in style with the Robin Hood Beer & Cider Festival 2016. Boasting the world's largest selection of over 1.000 cask conditioned real ales and 200 ciders, Nottingham Castle was sure to resemble a beer and cider oasis. Additionally there was food available at catering stalls of local suppliers plus live entertainment on the Victorian Bandstand. 

The Festival was organised and staffed entirely by volunteers. Friday 14 October 2016 and Saturday 15 October 2016 I volunteered on one of the main beer bars. Working at the Festival was great fun, the work was not too onerous and a range of benefits was offered.
